LanguageData.MengGuBack_KeHan.title: Tribal khan
LanguageData.MengGuBack_KeHan.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] won the unanimous approval of the tribal leaders with his amazing riding and shooting skills, and became the tribal khan. Facts have proved that [PAWN_pronoun] does have a deep city and ability to employ people. In the [PAWN_pronoun] Under the leadership of [PAWN_pronoun], the clan of [PAWN_pronoun] is moving towards a new stage of prosperity.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_BaiRenZhan.title: Mughal Brutal Butcher
LanguageData.MengGuBack_BaiRenZhan.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] won the unanimous approval of the tribal leaders with his amazing riding and shooting skills, and became the tribal khan. Facts have proved that [PAWN_pronoun] does have a deep city and ability to employ people. In the [PAWN_pronoun] Under the leadership of [PAWN_pronoun], the clan of [PAWN_pronoun] is moving towards a new stage of prosperity.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_GongJiang.title: Captured Craftsman of China
LanguageData.MengGuBack_GongJiang.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was originally a craftsman in the Shenzhou area. The ancient Shenzhou colony maintained the status tradition of "Scholar, Farmer, Industry and Commerce", so [PAWN_pronoun] had a very low status and was often discriminated against, while [PAWN_pronoun] was killed in a Mughal attack Captive to the Mughal tribe. \n\nFor the Mongols who are short of technical skills, skilled craftsmen like [PAWN_pronoun] are as precious as gold, so [PAWN_nameDef] is valued by the Mongols instead, so [PAWN_pronoun] is willing to Forged armor and made weapons for the Mughals.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_JinWei.title: Khan Attendant
LanguageData.MengGuBack_JinWei.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] is the elite of the Khan's guards. [PAWN_pronoun] maintains a high level of vigilance every day, monitoring every word and deed of the tribal nobles. Any threat that may harm the Khan will be eliminated by [PAWN_pronoun] in time Lose.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_GanSiDui.title: Mughal Suicide Squad
LanguageData.MengGuBack_GanSiDui.baseDesc: The Mughal tribe imitated the military system of China and established a death squad to charge into battle, and [PAWN_nameDef] is a member of the death squad. [PAWN_pronoun] would charge at the forefront every time, making a breakthrough for the subsequent Mughal siege troops. bloody way.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_TianZangShi.title: Mughal celestial burial master
LanguageData.MengGuBack_TianZangShi.baseDesc: Sky burial is a traditional burial method of Tibetan and Mongolian people in the old Shenzhou area. After death, the body is taken to a designated place for vultures (or other birds, beasts, etc.) to devour. It is essentially a social and cultural phenomenon, a belief, and a way of expressing mourning for the dead. \n\nMongols have inherited the tradition of sky burial, and [PAWN_nameDef] is a traditional sky burial master. During the long-term work, [PAWN_pronoun] has accumulated some medical experience and also mastered some knowledge of sacrifice .
LanguageData.MengGuBack_JiNaiChang.title: Mughal cow breeder
LanguageData.MengGuBack_JiNaiChang.baseDesc: The Mughal people imitated some advanced civilizations and established some modern pastures in the development of the marginal world, and [PAWN_nameDef] is a dairy breeder, and [PAWN_pronoun] is responsible for milking the cows and making milk products for the Mughal soldiers , for [PAWN_pronoun], there are more cows who have dealt with [PAWN_pronoun] than [PAWN_pronoun] knows people.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_SheShou.title: Betrayed Mughal Archer
LanguageData.MengGuBack_SheShou.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was betrayed by his sworn brother in a battle against the Chinese civilization. In order to compete with [PAWN_pronoun] for credit, [PAWN_pronoun]â€™s sworn brother tried to kill [PAWN_pronoun] from behind. Fortunately, [PAWN_pronoun] responded It counter-killed, and after that, [PAWN_pronoun] became cold-blooded and found it difficult to trust others.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_TouKaoZhe.title: Shenzhou refugee
LanguageData.MengGuBack_TouKaoZhe.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was originally a scholar in China. At first [PAWN_pronoun] aspired to be admitted to Jinshi through hard study, but unfortunately [PAWN_pronoun] was still unsuccessful. The disheartened [PAWN_pronoun] turned to seek refuge in the Mughal and helped The Mughal team leaders made suggestions and became a military adviser.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_AdultSaMan.title: Mughal Shaman
LanguageData.MengGuBack_AdultSaMan.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] is a shaman in charge of tribal ceremonies. Tengger is very important to the Mughals, so [PAWN_pronoun] has also received enough attention among the Mughals. In addition to completing the sacrificial ceremony, [PAWN_pronoun] will also study the cultures of some other civilizations.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_TaiShi.title: Mengwu "Grand Master"
LanguageData.MengGuBack_TaiShi.baseDesc: Perhaps the most well-known "Tai Shi" of the Mughals is Yexian. Even in the fringe world, the story of the Taishi Yexian is widely spread among the Mughals. [PAWN_nameDef] is the second in command of a Mughal tribe , was also honored as the "Grand Master", and for [PAWN_pronoun], [PAWN_pronoun]'s ambition is not limited to this, [PAWN_pronoun] is preparing to seek power and usurp the throne and unite all the Mughal tribes to jointly conquer the civilization of China.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_MuMin.title: Mughal herdsmen
LanguageData.MengGuBack_MuMin.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] is a herdsman on the Muwu grassland. Herdsman is the most common occupation among Muwu people. In order to make a living, [PAWN_pronoun] had to learn to master grazing and some farming skills.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_ShanYao.title: Shining World Muggle Commander
LanguageData.MengGuBack_ShanYao.baseDesc: In order to fight against the increasingly powerful heavenly soldiers and machines, the Mughal immigrants of Glittering World established a resistance force equipped with the most sophisticated weapons, and [PAWN_nameDef] was once a commander of the resistance force. Unfortunately, [PAWN_nameDef] The troops still could not withstand the onslaught of the heavenly soldiers, and [PAWN_nameDef] and his teammates were also separated.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_LieRen.title: Mogul Grassland Hunter
LanguageData.MengGuBack_LieRen.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up on the prairie and became a hunter when he became an adult. His long hunting career has trained [PAWN_nameDef]'s superb shooting skills. After learning about [PAWN_nameDef]'s reputation, many tribal leaders wanted to hire [PAWN_nameDef] has become a professional killer, and for [PAWN_nameDef], whether it is an assassination target or a prey running on the grassland, [PAWN_nameDef] can kill with one blow.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_MuMinZi.title: Son of herdsmen
LanguageData.MengGuBack_MuMinZi.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] is the child of a Mughal herdsman. [PAWN_pronoun] has been with cattle and sheep since he was a child. At the same time, [PAWN_pronoun] learned some riding and shooting skills from the adults.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_KeHanZi.title: Son of khan
LanguageData.MengGuBack_KeHanZi.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] is the son of a Great Khan of the Khanate. In order to successfully inherit the Khan, [PAWN_pronoun] has been educated about advanced culture and understanding people since he was a child.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_CongLin.title: Jungle Darling
LanguageData.MengGuBack_CongLin.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born in the forest close to the Muwu grasslands. Compared with the Muwu people who grew up in the grasslands since childhood, [PAWN_pronoun] knows how to be self-sufficient enough to cope with a harsher environment.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_TongZiBing.title: Mughal Boy Scouts
LanguageData.MengGuBack_TongZiBing.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was forcibly recruited into the Mughal boy scout army since he was a child, and [PAWN_pronoun] had to practice combat skills in order to survive in the battlefield.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_SaManZi.title: Son of Mughal Shaman
LanguageData.MengGuBack_SaManZi.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] is the son of the shaman of the Mughal tribe. For the Mughal people, the Tengger totem is very important, and [PAWN_pronoun] followed his parents to learn about sacrificial ceremonies, and also learned some chatting skills .
LanguageData.MengGuBack_QinMuZhe.title: Shenzhou admirer
LanguageData.MengGuBack_QinMuZhe.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born in the confluence of the Mughal tribe and the agricultural civilization of China. [PAWN_pronoun] has been influenced by the Chinese culture since he was a child. He is determined to learn the advanced culture of China and is determined to use his own practical actions to change the barbaric backwardness of the Mughal people. habit.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_PaiWaiMengWu.title: Xenophobic Mughal Children
LanguageData.MengGuBack_PaiWaiMengWu.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was born in a traditional Mughal tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] was influenced by the traditional Mughal concepts at an early age, and became hostile to Shenzhou and other civilizations. For [PAWN_pronoun], it is like Shenzhou Such a civilization is a potential object of conquest and plunder by the Mughals.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_HunXueEr.title: Mongolian-Chinese
LanguageData.MengGuBack_HunXueEr.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] is a hybrid of the Mughal and Chinese civilizations. [PAWN_pronoun] has lived in an atmosphere of national harmony since he was a child. Therefore, for [PAWN_pronoun], abandoning war and peaceful exchanges are the real way out for the two civilizations.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_HuangJinHouYi.title: Descendants of the Golden Family
LanguageData.MengGuBack_HuangJinHouYi.baseDesc: Like the old Shenzhou world, one of the most powerful Mughal tribes in the marginal world is called the "Golden Family", and [PAWN_nameDef] was born in such a prominent tribe, and lived a pampered life since he was a child.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_YouNu.title: Mughal slaves
LanguageData.MengGuBack_YouNu.baseDesc: The Mughals like to plunder, whether it is wealth or population, they will become the targets of their conquest, and the village where [PAWN_nameDef] lived was looted by the Mughals since he was a child, and [PAWN_pronoun] has also become a slave, living a Working as an ox and a horse for the Mughals.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_GuEr.title: Mughal orphans
LanguageData.MengGuBack_GuEr.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was abandoned by his parents since he was a child. Unexpectedly, [PAWN_pronoun] was rescued by the wolves on the Mengwu grassland, and gradually grew up with the help of the wolves, and finally [PAWN_pronoun] was rescued by the wolves on the grassland. Herdsmen discovered and eventually returned to Mughal society. \n\n[PAWN_pronoun] lost his language ability due to his childhood experience.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_NongMin.title: Son of a conquered peasant
LanguageData.MengGuBack_NongMin.baseDesc: Since the Mughals mainly lived in semi-arid areas at first, there were very few farmers of the Mughals. However, as the Mughals conquered foreign countries, the people in some farming areas also obeyed the Mughals' rule. \n\nAs for [PAWN_nameDef], the son of a farmer in a conquered area, [PAWN_pronoun] was forced to learn the Mughal language and some farming techniques from an early age.
LanguageData.MengGuBack_YiGu.title: Tribal orphans
LanguageData.MengGuBack_YiGu.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] is the son of a Mughal tribal leader, but [PAWN_pronoun]'s tribe was bloodbathed by hostile tribes, and only [PAWN_nameDef] survived. But [PAWN_pronoun] did not sink down there, [PAWN_pronoun] painstakingly learned strategy and fighting skills, only to send all the enemies of [PAWN_pronoun] to the grave in the future.
